intro: Froelichia lanata var. paraguayensis, commonly known as the Paraguay hairleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along riverbanks, thriving in moist, clayey soils. It is known for its fibrous roots and can form dense stands in its habitat. Due to its ecological importance, it is sometimes used in restoration projects in its native range.
